page.title: 03Transport
page.content: The area is a honeycomb of tiny lanes, many of which are in a semi wild state, containing a vast variety of flora and fauna. Some lanes are only surfaced occasionally, and are used largely for access by farmers and local residents. There is one "B" road the B5026, which traverses the block and is used by lorries and other commercial vehicles as a link road between major roads to the east and west of the block. There is a privately owned bus service which operates on Tuesdays and Saturdays to Stafford, and one bus each Wednesday to Market Drayton Market. Part of an old coach road exists in parts, wheel tracks are still visible in the soft sandstone. Coaches used it between Newport and Eccleshall.
